item.title: Let's Encrypt on TrueNAS Core
item.description: This is how I use Let’s Encrypt certificates on TrueNAS Core with Cloudflare as a DNS authenticator. TrueNAS Core already has built-in support for ACME DNS authentication, but the only DNS authenticator it supports is Route 53. This process will create a certbot jail that: Configures certbot to get a Let’s Encrypt wildcard certificate Runs certbot renew every 12 hours Saves certificates to a dataset so that they can be used by other services Deploys renewed certificates to the TrueNAS UI You can skip the stuff about creating a dataset and mounting it to the jail if you don’t want to use the certificates for anything other than the TrueNAS UI.
